text:
hi. can anyone help me with the `regex_replace(x, y)` filter. I want to replace a shortcode with something else.
Example:
```[anchor id="anchor-name"]Click here[/anchor] => <a href="anchor-name">Click here</a>```
thanks
I think you want to do:

```{% dnd_module path='../../modules/text-module.module', 
        offset=0, 
        width=12,
        heading_text='Curate your content 2',
        advanced = { selected_font: 'tm1', heading_level: 'p'}
      %}        
      {% end_dnd_module %}```

thanks you are right. i did not notice the lazy loading effect (normally i see a blank space before the image shows up). but i've inspected in the network section of the browser and it's loading the image in the end. so great Mitja!
I wouldn’t recommend this - parsing stuff like this with regex is very flakey
Is there reason why you can’t just use HTML?
How to print a variation like console.log() in javascript
if you set `hubdb_table_rows(table_id, params)` to a variable, you should be able to run an `if` check on it

so something like
```{% set results = hubdb_table_rows(table_id, params) %}
{% if results %}Found results
{% else %}No results Found
{% endif %```
(not tested, but should work
